page.title: 16THE VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Situated in the centre of Marston, the village school caters for the primary children of both villages. The old school was held in the church vestry at Marston founded in 1716. The present school was erected in 1861 and is aided by the Church of England. The children used to sit in rows but now they sit in groups, occasionally having lessons outside on sunny days. Children are taught in two classes, 4 - 7 and 7 - 11 yrs. The school has a football team and the children go swimming every week in Grantham. The school kitchens are now unused and the children have to bring packed lunches. The building although old is light and warm having central heating. There is a hardcore playground and a playing field with running track and sand pit.
